Instruction: In a bowl, combine sugar, cornmeal, flour, and salt, mixing until blended; then add the eggs.
Combine milk and melted butter in a bowl and mix until smooth; then add to the cornmeal mixture, stirring until smooth, for about 5 minutes.
Grease a griddle and heat it on high. Portion tablespoonfuls of the cornmeal mixture into the skillet; cook until golden brown, approximately 5 minutes per side.
Margarine may be used as a substitute for butter, if preferred.
